type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"NewsArticle","mainEntityOfPage":"https://www.timesnownews.com/entertainment-news/gumraah-movie-review-aditya-roy-kapur-mrunal-thakur-deliver-perfect-crime-thriller-with-twisted-judwa-element-imdb-rating-public-review-article-99305550","url":"https://www.timesnownews.com/entertainment-news/gumraah-movie-review-aditya-roy-kapur-mrunal-thakur-deliver-perfect-crime-thriller-with-twisted-judwa-element-imdb-rating-public-review-article-99305550","articleBody":"On a chilly rainy night, when no one could have possibly thought, a man clad in a yellow raincoat breaks inside a huge mansion, and soon after, he brutally murders his victim with an icebreaker tool, sending a chill down everyone's spine. The man in the raincoat might be Ronnie or Arjun Sehgal, two identical twins, played by Aditya Roy Kapur, but WHY does he paint his hands with someone's blood? Is the question you would ask yourself as soon as the film begins. Directed by Vardhan Ketkar, Gumraah is an engaging tale, starring Aditya Roy Kapur in a double role, Mrunal Thakur as an Inspector, and Ronit Roy in the role of ACP, who offer just the right amount of drama, suspense, grilling, and chills in this crime thriller with unbelievably surprising twists and turns.Gumraah Movie: StorylineGumraah, a remake of the 2019 movie Thadam, narrates the story of Ronnie and Arjun Sehgal, identical twins who have significantly different personalities, habits, and lifestyles, but there's something unique that connects and ignites the fire of unity in them, despite their disturbed relationship. However, their paths recross when they are identified as key suspects in a horrific murder case that Shivani (played by Mrunal) and Dhiren (played by Ronit) are looking into. Just when the police department thinks they have found the murderer, they come face-to-face with another look-alike, who 'gumraahs' the investigative officers, forensics department, and audience in such a way that you will bite your nails in curiosity. How do these identical twins become suspects in the same murder case? Are they REALLY related to each other? Do they have a common past? Why they try to play the hide-and-seek game with the police while carrying hatred and love in their hearts? All these questions that will be catered in this sincere attempt to deliver a crime thriller by Vardhan Ketkar that will keep you hooked and amazed!Gumraah Movie: PerformancesIt feels like a breath of fresh air to see Aditya Roy Kapur ace the double role. We must agree that he is highly underrated as an actor who often falls victim to poor scripts, but with Gumraah he really managed to deliver a natural performance.However, as said earlier, theres much more to him than just being the boy next door or a rowdy gangsta, and you might feel the same loopholes even in his roles as Arjun and Ronnie. Aditya nailed the transitions in his dual role crisply. As Ronni, he was rugged, vile, and equal parts wannabe, wearing floral-printed shirts and holding cigars. He is a gambler, and Kapur nailed his body language gracefully.On the other hand, him as Arjun, a civil engineer who has a love interest in Janhvi (played by Vedika Pinto), is appealing to watch. You might feel a bit monotonous watching him differentiate his roles in the first half of the film, but he shows great perfection in the second half, making these characters one memorable affair for him.Mrunal Thakur, as Inspector Shivani Mathur, is equal parts breezy and sharp. She knows where to open her mouth and how to use her hands and facial expressions to resonate with the role of a cop. With Aditya's intense roles in the film, Mrunal is the perfect breather. However, her role seems half-baked and abruptly written.Ronit Roy and Deepak Kalra were perfect at their crafts. They brought equal support as the supporting characters in the film, making it a comical and vile watch at the desired intervals. Vedika Pinto has limited screen time, but she seemed as fresh as a daisy in her appearance as Janhvi, Arjun's (Aditya) love interest. Gumraah Movie Review: DirectionThe first half of the movie's plot may seem a little slow, but you must give it time and patience because you are in for a surprise. There are no loopholes in the script per se. The direction of the movie is precise and tidy. The action scenes don't appear to be staged, especially the one with Aditya in a double role. For a second, you would go, 'are they seriously one person?'Vedika and Aditya's romantic scenes, how they meet, and their cute love story are well shot. The movie is much more than just a crime thriller; it also highlights the underlined, nasty truth that lies in the system of the police department, gambling, parenting, and sibling rivalry.The film beautifully derives narratives from the repercussions of childhood trauma, addiction, and the anguish of separation, and how Ketkar blends all of these is commendable.Gumraah Movie Review: VerdictYou are in for a treat if you love power-pact crime dramas with unexpected twists. The judwa element in the film is pure work of a good storyline, which might seem a bit undercooked in a few scenes, but overall you won't be disappointed. One must give Aditya Roy Kapur's thriller a chance, as he has tried immensely to impress his audience, and those good looks are just a bonus. Mrunal, what can we say about her? She is an established actress who knows how to carry the story of the film. All in all, you must allow yourself to get a bit 'gumraah' with Gumraah!","datePublished":"2023-04-07T10:19:39+05:30","dateModified":"2023-04-07T10:19:39+05:30","articleSection":"Entertainment","headline":"Gumraah Movie Review: Aditya Roy Kapur, Mrunal Thakur Are they REALLY related to each other? Do they have a common past? Why they try to play the hide-and-seek game with the police while carrying hatred and love in their hearts? All these questions that will be catered in this sincere attempt to deliver a crime thriller by Vardhan Ketkar that will keep you hooked and amazed!</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><strong></strong></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">Gumraah Movie: Performances</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">It feels like a breath of fresh air to see <strong>Aditya Roy Kapur </strong>ace the double role. We must agree that he is highly underrated as an actor who often falls victim to poor scripts, but with <em>Gumraah</em> he really managed to deliver a natural performance.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">However, as said earlier, theres much more to him than just being the boy next door or a rowdy gangsta, and you might feel the same loopholes even in his roles as Arjun and Ronnie. Aditya nailed the transitions in his dual role crisply. As Ronni, he was rugged, vile, and equal parts wannabe, wearing floral-printed shirts and holding cigars. He is a gambler, and Kapur nailed his body language gracefully.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">On the other hand, him as Arjun, a civil engineer who has a love interest in Janhvi (played by Vedika Pinto), is appealing to watch. You might feel a bit monotonous watching him differentiate his roles in the first half of the film, but he shows great perfection in the second half, making these characters one memorable affair for him.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><strong>Mrunal Thakur</strong>, as Inspector Shivani Mathur, is equal parts breezy and sharp. She knows where to open her mouth and how to use her hands and facial expressions to resonate with the role of a cop. With Aditya's intense roles in the film, Mrunal is the perfect breather. However, her role seems half-baked and abruptly written.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><strong>Ronit Roy and Deepak Kalra </strong>were perfect at their crafts. They brought equal support as the supporting characters in the film, making it a comical and vile watch at the desired intervals. </div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><strong></strong></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">Vedika Pinto has limited screen time, but she seemed as fresh as a daisy in her appearance as Janhvi, Arjun's (Aditya) love interest. </div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><strong><keyword id="17059756" type="General" weightage="20" keywordseo="Gumraah-Movie-Review" source="Orion">Gumraah Movie Review</keyword>: Direction</strong></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">The first half of the movie's plot may seem a little slow, but you must give it time and patience because you are in for a surprise. There are no loopholes in the script per se. The direction of the movie is precise and tidy. The action scenes don't appear to be staged, especially the one with Aditya in a double role. For a second, you would go, 'are they seriously one person?'</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">Vedika and Aditya's romantic scenes, how they meet, and their cute love story are well shot. The movie is much more than just a crime thriller; it also highlights the underlined, nasty truth that lies in the system of the police department, gambling, parenting, and sibling rivalry.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">The film beautifully derives narratives from the repercussions of childhood trauma, addiction, and the anguish of separation, and how Ketkar blends all of these is commendable.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><strong>Gumraah Movie Review: Verdict</strong></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">You are in for a treat if you love power-pact crime dramas with unexpected twists. The <em>judwa</em> element in the film is pure work of a good storyline, which might seem a bit undercooked in a few scenes, but overall you won't be disappointed. One must give Aditya Roy Kapur's thriller a chance, as he has tried immensely to impress his audience, and those good looks are just a bonus. Mrunal, what can we say about her? She is an established actress who knows how to carry the story of the film. All in all, you must allow yourself to get a bit '<em>gumraah</em>' with <em>Gumraah!</em></div></div><section class="trinity-skip-it"><div class="rdE5S"><div class="_2sQQR"><button><a a chilly rainy night, when no one could have possibly thought, a man clad in a yellow raincoat breaks inside a huge mansion, and soon after, he brutally murders his victim with an icebreaker tool, sending a chill down everyone's spine. The man in the raincoat might be Ronnie or Arjun Sehgal, two identical twins, played by Aditya Roy Kapur, but WHY does he paint his hands with someone's blood? Is the question you would ask yourself as soon as the film begins. Directed by Vardhan Ketkar, Gumraah is an engaging tale, starring Aditya Roy Kapur in a double role, Mrunal Thakur as an Inspector, and Ronit Roy in the role of ACP, who offer just the right amount of drama, suspense, grilling, and chills in this crime thriller with unbelievably surprising twists and turns.Gumraah Movie: StorylineGumraah, a remake of the 2019 movie Thadam, narrates the story of Ronnie and Arjun Sehgal, identical twins who have significantly different personalities, habits, and lifestyles, but there's something unique that connects and ignites the fire of unity in them, despite their disturbed relationship. However, their paths recross when they are identified as key suspects in a horrific murder case that Shivani (played by Mrunal) and Dhiren (played by Ronit) are looking into. Just when the police department thinks they have found the murderer, they come face-to-face with another look-alike, who 'gumraahs' the investigative officers, forensics department, and audience in such a way that you will bite your nails in curiosity. How do these identical twins become suspects in the same murder case? Are they REALLY related to each other? Do they have a common past? Why they try to play the hide-and-seek game with the police while carrying hatred and love in their hearts? All these questions that will be catered in this sincere attempt to deliver a crime thriller by Vardhan Ketkar that will keep you hooked and amazed!Gumraah Movie: PerformancesIt feels like a breath of fresh air to see Aditya Roy Kapur ace the double role. We must agree that he is highly underrated as an actor who often falls victim to poor scripts, but with Gumraah he really managed to deliver a natural performance.However, as said earlier, theres much more to him than just being the boy next door or a rowdy gangsta, and you might feel the same loopholes even in his roles as Arjun and Ronnie. Aditya nailed the transitions in his dual role crisply. As Ronni, he was rugged, vile, and equal parts wannabe, wearing floral-printed shirts and holding cigars. He is a gambler, and Kapur nailed his body language gracefully.On the other hand, him as Arjun, a civil engineer who has a love interest in Janhvi (played by Vedika Pinto), is appealing to watch. You might feel a bit monotonous watching him differentiate his roles in the first half of the film, but he shows great perfection in the second half, making these characters one memorable affair for him.Mrunal Thakur, as Inspector Shivani Mathur, is equal parts breezy and sharp. She knows where to open her mouth and how to use her hands and facial expressions to resonate with the role of a cop. With Aditya's intense roles in the film, Mrunal is the perfect breather. However, her role seems half-baked and abruptly written.Ronit Roy and Deepak Kalra were perfect at their crafts. They brought equal support as the supporting characters in the film, making it a comical and vile watch at the desired intervals. Vedika Pinto has limited screen time, but she seemed as fresh as a daisy in her appearance as Janhvi, Arjun's (Aditya) love interest. Gumraah Movie Review: DirectionThe first half of the movie's plot may seem a little slow, but you must give it time and patience because you are in for a surprise. There are no loopholes in the script per se. The direction of the movie is precise and tidy. The action scenes don't appear to be staged, especially the one with Aditya in a double role. For a second, you would go, 'are they seriously one person?'Vedika and Aditya's romantic scenes, how they meet, and their cute love story are well shot. The movie is much more than just a crime thriller; it also highlights the underlined, nasty truth that lies in the system of the police department, gambling, parenting, and sibling rivalry.The film beautifully derives narratives from the repercussions of childhood trauma, addiction, and the anguish of separation, and how Ketkar blends all of these is commendable.Gumraah Movie Review: VerdictYou are in for a treat if you love power-pact crime dramas with unexpected twists. One must give Aditya Roy Kapur's thriller a chance, as he has tried immensely to impress his audience, and those good looks are just a bonus. Mrunal, what can we say about her? Ravanasura movie Twitter Review The film which released in theatres today already has fans buzzing about it on social media. I strongly believe that Ravanasura will entertain everyone and will draw whistles on 7th April. We call Abhishek Nama a cute boy. Even the film title and the title design are his ideas. Jr NTR was last seen in SS Rajamouli's magnum opus RRR alongside Ram Charan which created history by winning Best Original Song for Naatu Naatu at Oscars 2023. Now, latest reports suggest that Jr NTR has massively hiked his fees for the project. Jr NTR hikes his fee by 100 percent for War 2 As per reports, Jr NTR had charged Rs 45 crore for S. S. Rajamouli's RRR. It seems that the move was taken by the actor after the massive success of Oscar-winning RRR. Now, the Telugu actor has increased his remuneration by a 100 percent to star in the Ayan Mukerji directorial. As per a report in Bollywood Hungama, Jr NTR will be charging Rs 100 crore for War 2. However, the news has not been confirmed by the actor or his team yet. Ayan Mukerji helming War 2 As per a report in Variety, a source privy to War 2 had revealed that Brahmastra director Ayan Mukerji would be directing War 2 and not Sidharth Anand. The source was quoted as saying, \"Aditya Chopra is choosing the captain of the ship for each YRF spy universe film strategically.” The source added, “Ayan has delivered big hits which appeals to all audience segments and has the pulse of Indian audiences. He has shown that he knows how to mount a film with a huge scale, which is essential for someone to direct ‘War 2.’ Plus, he is a young filmmaker who can bring a different kind of newness to the spy universe. Ayan will have his unique take on how to make an epic action spectacle with ‘War 2.’ Aditya Chopra trusts him to take the franchise forward.” ","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"War 2: Did Jr NTR Charge Rs 100 CRORE After RRR Oscar Win To Star Alongside Hrithik Roshan?","cmssource":"CMSLITE","parenttitle":"Entertainment","titleforurl":"war 2: did jr ntr charge rs 100 crore after rrr oscar win to star alongside hrithik roshan?","synopsis":"It was recently announced that Telugu superstar Jr NTR will be joining the cast of the Hrithik Roshan's War 2. main.articleBody: On a chilly rainy night, when no one could have possibly thought, a man clad in a yellow raincoat breaks inside a huge mansion, and soon after, he brutally murders his victim with an icebreaker tool, sending a chill down everyone's spine. The man in the raincoat might be Ronnie or Arjun Sehgal, two identical twins, played by Aditya Roy Kapur, but WHY does he paint his hands with someone's blood? Is the question you would ask yourself as soon as the film begins. Directed by Vardhan Ketkar, Gumraah is an engaging tale, starring Aditya Roy Kapur in a double role, Mrunal Thakur as an Inspector, and Ronit Roy in the role of ACP, who offer just the right amount of drama, suspense, grilling, and chills in this crime thriller with unbelievably surprising twists and turns.Gumraah Movie: StorylineGumraah, a remake of the 2019 movie Thadam, narrates the story of Ronnie and Arjun Sehgal, identical twins who have significantly different personalities, habits, and lifestyles, but there's something unique that connects and ignites the fire of unity in them, despite their disturbed relationship. However, their paths recross when they are identified as key suspects in a horrific murder case that Shivani (played by Mrunal) and Dhiren (played by Ronit) are looking into. Just when the police department thinks they have found the murderer, they come face-to-face with another look-alike, who 'gumraahs' the investigative officers, forensics department, and audience in such a way that you will bite your nails in curiosity. How do these identical twins become suspects in the same murder case? Are they REALLY related to each other? Do they have a common past? Why they try to play the hide-and-seek game with the police while carrying hatred and love in their hearts? All these questions that will be catered in this sincere attempt to deliver a crime thriller by Vardhan Ketkar that will keep you hooked and amazed!Gumraah Movie: PerformancesIt feels like a breath of fresh air to see Aditya Roy Kapur ace the double role. We must agree that he is highly underrated as an actor who often falls victim to poor scripts, but with Gumraah he really managed to deliver a natural performance.However, as said earlier, theres much more to him than just being the boy next door or a rowdy gangsta, and you might feel the same loopholes even in his roles as Arjun and Ronnie. Aditya nailed the transitions in his dual role crisply. As Ronni, he was rugged, vile, and equal parts wannabe, wearing floral-printed shirts and holding cigars. He is a gambler, and Kapur nailed his body language gracefully.On the other hand, him as Arjun, a civil engineer who has a love interest in Janhvi (played by Vedika Pinto), is appealing to watch. You might feel a bit monotonous watching him differentiate his roles in the first half of the film, but he shows great perfection in the second half, making these characters one memorable affair for him.Mrunal Thakur, as Inspector Shivani Mathur, is equal parts breezy and sharp. She knows where to open her mouth and how to use her hands and facial expressions to resonate with the role of a cop. With Aditya's intense roles in the film, Mrunal is the perfect breather. However, her role seems half-baked and abruptly written.Ronit Roy and Deepak Kalra were perfect at their crafts. They brought equal support as the supporting characters in the film, making it a comical and vile watch at the desired intervals. Vedika Pinto has limited screen time, but she seemed as fresh as a daisy in her appearance as Janhvi, Arjun's (Aditya) love interest. Gumraah Movie Review: DirectionThe first half of the movie's plot may seem a little slow, but you must give it time and patience because you are in for a surprise. There are no loopholes in the script per se. The direction of the movie is precise and tidy. The action scenes don't appear to be staged, especially the one with Aditya in a double role. For a second, you would go, 'are they seriously one person?'Vedika and Aditya's romantic scenes, how they meet, and their cute love story are well shot. The movie is much more than just a crime thriller; it also highlights the underlined, nasty truth that lies in the system of the police department, gambling, parenting, and sibling rivalry.The film beautifully derives narratives from the repercussions of childhood trauma, addiction, and the anguish of separation, and how Ketkar blends all of these is commendable.Gumraah Movie Review: VerdictYou are in for a treat if you love power-pact crime dramas with unexpected twists. The judwa element in the film is pure work of a good storyline, which might seem a bit undercooked in a few scenes, but overall you won't be disappointed. One must give Aditya Roy Kapur's thriller a chance, as he has tried immensely to impress his audience, and those good looks are just a bonus. Mrunal, what can we say about her? She is an established actress who knows how to carry the story of the film. All in all, you must allow yourself to get a bit 'gumraah' with Gumraah!
main.headline: Gumraah Movie Review: Aditya Roy Kapur, Mrunal Thakur Deliver Perfect Crime-Thriller with Twisted Judwa Elemen
main.keywords: gumraah movie,aditya roy kapur,Gumraah Movie Review,mrunal thakur,Thadam,
main.description: Gumraah Movie Review: Starring Aditya Roy Kapur, Mrunal Thakur, and Ronit Roy, Gumraah is an engaging tale concerning two identical twins, Sooraj and Ronnie (played by Kapur), who get trapped after a brutal murder comes into the limelight, with added mystery and twists, but their haunting past has something to promise that might make or break this dark thriller about crime, love, and separation.

description: Gumraah Movie Review: Starring Aditya Roy Kapur, Mrunal Thakur, and Ronit Roy, Gumraah is an engaging tale concerning two identical twins, Sooraj and Ronnie (played by Kapur), who get trapped after a brutal murder comes into the limelight, with added mystery and twists, but their haunting past has something to promise that might make or break this dark thriller about crime, love, and separation.
text: On a chilly rainy night, when no one could have possibly thought, a man clad in a yellow raincoat breaks inside a huge mansion, and soon after, he brutally murders his victim with an icebreaker tool, sending a chill down everyone's spine. The man in the raincoat might be Ronnie or Arjun Sehgal, two identical twins, played by Aditya Roy Kapur, but WHY does he paint his hands with someone's blood? Is the question you would ask yourself as soon as the film begins. Directed by Vardhan Ketkar, Gumraah is an engaging tale, starring Aditya Roy Kapur in a double role, Mrunal Thakur as an Inspector, and Ronit Roy in the role of ACP, who offer just the right amount of drama, suspense, grilling, and chills in this crime thriller with unbelievably surprising twists and turns.Gumraah Movie: StorylineGumraah, a remake of the 2019 movie Thadam, narrates the story of Ronnie and Arjun Sehgal, identical twins who have significantly different personalities, habits, and lifestyles, but there's something unique that connects and ignites the fire of unity in them, despite their disturbed relationship. However, their paths recross when they are identified as key suspects in a horrific murder case that Shivani (played by Mrunal) and Dhiren (played by Ronit) are looking into. Just when the police department thinks they have found the murderer, they come face-to-face with another look-alike, who 'gumraahs' the investigative officers, forensics department, and audience in such a way that you will bite your nails in curiosity. How do these identical twins become suspects in the same murder case? Are they REALLY related to each other? Do they have a common past? Why they try to play the hide-and-seek game with the police while carrying hatred and love in their hearts? All these questions that will be catered in this sincere attempt to deliver a crime thriller by Vardhan Ketkar that will keep you hooked and amazed!Gumraah Movie: PerformancesIt feels like a breath of fresh air to see Aditya Roy Kapur ace the double role. We must agree that he is highly underrated as an actor who often falls victim to poor scripts, but with Gumraah he really managed to deliver a natural performance.However, as said earlier, theres much more to him than just being the boy next door or a rowdy gangsta, and you might feel the same loopholes even in his roles as Arjun and Ronnie. Aditya nailed the transitions in his dual role crisply. As Ronni, he was rugged, vile, and equal parts wannabe, wearing floral-printed shirts and holding cigars. He is a gambler, and Kapur nailed his body language gracefully.On the other hand, him as Arjun, a civil engineer who has a love interest in Janhvi (played by Vedika Pinto), is appealing to watch. You might feel a bit monotonous watching him differentiate his roles in the first half of the film, but he shows great perfection in the second half, making these characters one memorable affair for him.Mrunal Thakur, as Inspector Shivani Mathur, is equal parts breezy and sharp. She knows where to open her mouth and how to use her hands and facial expressions to resonate with the role of a cop. With Aditya's intense roles in the film, Mrunal is the perfect breather. However, her role seems half-baked and abruptly written.Ronit Roy and Deepak Kalra were perfect at their crafts. They brought equal support as the supporting characters in the film, making it a comical and vile watch at the desired intervals. Vedika Pinto has limited screen time, but she seemed as fresh as a daisy in her appearance as Janhvi, Arjun's (Aditya) love interest. Gumraah Movie Review: DirectionThe first half of the movie's plot may seem a little slow, but you must give it time and patience because you are in for a surprise. There are no loopholes in the script per se. The direction of the movie is precise and tidy. The action scenes don't appear to be staged, especially the one with Aditya in a double role. For a second, you would go, 'are they seriously one person?'Vedika and Aditya's romantic scenes, how they meet, and their cute love story are well shot. The movie is much more than just a crime thriller; it also highlights the underlined, nasty truth that lies in the system of the police department, gambling, parenting, and sibling rivalry.The film beautifully derives narratives from the repercussions of childhood trauma, addiction, and the anguish of separation, and how Ketkar blends all of these is commendable.Gumraah Movie Review: VerdictYou are in for a treat if you love power-pact crime dramas with unexpected twists. The judwa element in the film is pure work of a good storyline, which might seem a bit undercooked in a few scenes, but overall you won't be disappointed. One must give Aditya Roy Kapur's thriller a chance, as he has tried immensely to impress his audience, and those good looks are just a bonus. Mrunal, what can we say about her? She is an established actress who knows how to carry the story of the film. All in all, you must allow yourself to get a bit 'gumraah' with Gumraah!
title: Gumraah Movie Review: Aditya Roy Kapur, Mrunal Thakur Deliver Perfect Crime-Thriller with Twisted Judwa Element
